result.execSummary:
The defendant Mateo Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs. Court costs are paid in full.
------------------------------

Pay Sheriff's fees in the amount of $104.89 - paid in full.
------------------------------

No contact with the victims. No contact with the co-actors. No alcohol, drugs, or drug paraphernalia. 
------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
------------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommended counseling.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before March 20, 2015 @ 8:00 am. Conditional release jail time may be served in Kenosha County. Defendant may travel to Illinois for all permissible purposes while on release from jail.  The defendant is to receive a total of one-hundred and twenty-nine (129) days of dead time credit AGAINST HIS CONDITIONAL RELEASE JAIL TIME.

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
---------------------------------
*AMENDMENT 12/27/2017 - Pursuant to letter from DOC and Order of the Court, Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect sentence credit in the amount of 343 days. 
------------------------------------------
*AMENDMENT 8/6/2018 Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect sentence credit in the amount of 345 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with victims. No contact with co-actors. No alcohol, drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Defendant Mateo  Garcia in court with attorney James Duquette.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter has not resolved and parties confirm they are ready to proceed to trial on Monday.  The Court will designate this case as a "back up" to another Trial which is currently scheduled to proceed on Monday.  If the #1 case settles, this case will proceed.  Parties confirm there are no pre-trial issues to address at this time.  Court will set new FPT and JT dates at this time in the event this case is "bumped."  The Court's Clerk will advise the attorneys by noon on Friday whether this case will be tried on Monday or if it has been officially bumped from Monday's trial calendar.  MInutes filed. Defendant Mateo Garcia in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes/Edward Bailey.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Schwantes is denied. Bond remains and court dates remain as scheduled. Minutes filed.

MUST POST $1,000.00 CASH.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.
